project.teaser: Agroforestery (AF) has already proven its potential for farm sustainability, climate change mitigation & adaptation, biodiversity preservation, and soil conservation. However, AF performances are context-dependent, and many barriers hinder its adoption, such as lack of tools...
project.title: DIGItal Tools to help AgroForestry meet climate, biodiversity and farming sustainability goals: linking field and cloud
project.keywords: Agroforestery, Agroforestery systems, Digital, Farm sustainability, Farm viability, Value chain, Policy, Climate change adaptation, Climate change mitigation, Biodiversity, Common agricultural policy

result.title: Project website
result.description: Project website to communicate the project and its findings. A plug-in will be added to translate content into national languages.

result.title: Mapping of AF stakeholders
result.description: Identification of profiles of the different stakeholders that are concerned with agroforestry (policy-makers, practitioners, beneficiaries), including type of mesage and media to which they are most susceptible to react favorably.

result.title: Tree architectural parameters obtained from LIDAR scans
result.description: In this dataset the relevant tree architectural parameters can be found, to validate and improve the tree architectural component of AF system models.

result.description: Practice abstracts (PAs) in the EIP-AGRI format with the aim to facilitate the flow of information from projects to end-users (farmers and foresters) and share relevant innovative and practice-oriented knowledge developed in the projects.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DIGITAF (DIGItal Tools to help AgroForestry meet climate, biodiversity and farming sustainability goals: linking field and cloud)
result.teaser: Although AF is recognised as one of the most effective climate change mitigation measures, few Member States had successfully supported it in their recent funding programmes. Farmers’ concerns include the technical feasibility of AF, difficulty to predict the impact of their...

category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Plan for improvement of existing tools/models for tree and crop productivity
result.description: List of available models that can be used to predict agronomical performance of agroforestry, analysis of their strengths and weaknesses, and plan for improvement

result.title: Evaluation of announced national CAP Strategic Plan measures for establishment and maintenance of AF and Landscape Features
result.description: Summary of measures in national draft national CAP Strategic Plans for establishment and management of agroforestry and Landscape Features. Including sections on a) Conditionality, b) Ecoschemes, c) Rural Development, d) Carbon Farming.

result.description: Report summarizing stakeholders needs and expectations as well as data and tools in use based on stakeholder questionnaires.

result.title: Communication kit
result.description: Creation and delivery of the complete visual identity materials to partners in order to ensure the transfer of a recognisable and coherent image of the project in all communication and dissemination activities.

result.title: Roadmap 1.0 on anticipated benefits and costs of AF innovations.
result.description: This first version roadmap describes the results of a survey used to identify and quantify the major financial and economic benefits and costs related to different AF scenarios

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
